text: Tap at their depressing yet somehow loveable brewpub on eastersunday - full of great characters. eight men, one on every table, from time to time shouting something at each other and talking about death. price was 1,80, tip not accepted. I adore their landbier, the vollbier is a nice but average franconian helles, to be honest. fresh and crisp. mildly bitter.

500ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut and ultimately his secret santa SinH4!
Really starchy aroma, yeah, thats a dortmunder/helles. Is it macro. Woh, salt and vinegar crisps - clear sodium diacetate. Taste is milky porridge oats. Finish is starchy, pretty buttery too. Imno fan of this family of lagers, and this is not a particularly good example in this state. This was right at its BB, and I can believe that a fresh one would be way better. This is a bit macroey, to be honest.

Bottle, bb 30.12.2016 (thanks santa SinH4). Pours golden. Aroma is grainy, butterscotch, malt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, grains, malt, some butterscotch. Finish is dry bitter. Overall: okish, but again would like fresher sample.

500ml bottle shared by Mart, thanks! Clear yellow beer, small white head. Nose is malty, sweetness, starch. Watery, starch, water, some industrial notes. Watery and salty finish, aftertaste is almost like salted crisps.

500ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Clear pale golden color. Small size, white head, stays. Sourish, grainy, some metallic hops, some caramel in aroma. Grainy, caramel, grassy hops, sweet in taste. Grainy and mildly spicy hops in aftertaste. Soft carbonation. Tastes better than smells. Solid brew.

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4 (and a little help by derA), many thanks! Pours clear golden with a big but shortlived head. Aroma is malt-dominated, but with a clear fleshy fruitness, little hay. Body is light to medium, with a lively carbonation to make it refreshing and pleasant. Gentle in flavours, but not neglecting them, rather bringing out the beauty of what a lager can be. Palate continues the light malt flavours, gushing down with some water without getting thin. Extremely pleasant throughout. Very smooth and round experience. Superb!

surprising nose of pear, some wet malt, a little bit of cotton maybe, mouthfeel is more entertaining than most Dortmunder Helles, a lot of tiny bubbles make for an uplifting malt character, finish is almost refreshing but also with pronounced sweetness. An excellent Helles!

From barrel @Ma che siete venuti a fà (Rome). Pours golden with a medium white head. Aroma of milk bread, corn, malt, honey, grass. Flavour is medium sweet with a good bitterness, round and tasty. Medium body, soft carbonation. Very good beer!

Tap at the brewery. Grassy nose. 
Golden, big offwhite head.
Medium light dry body, light chalky, dry yet sweet hayish, with grassy finish , nice

Clear golden with fluffy white head. Aroma is citrus, noble hops, toast. Taste is slightly spicy sourness, buttery smoothness, hop tartness. Finish is medium and more or less the same. Juicy mouthfeel, not bad.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2016 Tap. Clear golden color with fluffy white head. Aroma is grainy, some citrusy hops, juicy malts. Taste is grainy, again these tasty juicy malts, so smooth. Oily mouthfeel, with quite an assertive bitterness in the finish that fits. Very refreshing, some of the best Lagers there is - but their Landbier is better, indeed.
18.11.2016 bottle at Café Klatsch Ansbach - Aroma of light pale malt body some decent hop notes. Some popcornish sweet caramel and light malt body taste. Again some decent bitter hop notes in taste.

Tap @ Brewery. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of Chewy caramel, quite bready, light citrus, light minerals, light wood, quite fruity in a way. Taste is rather malty, very czech alike, a solid hop kick with citrus and fruits. World Class.

Draught at Brauerei Witzgall, Hallendorf. Clear golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Great bready biscuit aroma, cereal notes, fruity notes. Biscuit flavor, caramel, cereal notes, slightly nutty, some grassy hops. Amazing beer.
On tap at the brewery. Almost deserted brew pub with only a couple old people sitting around drinking. Beer was golden franconian lager! At 1.80 EUR for 500ml unbeatable.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2017 At the brewery from tap and later in Berlin from a bottle. 

Rerating this. Still very good but I have a bunch better lately. Still worth going to the brewery for the experience alone. Just a great place to drink beer and forget about ratings :)
I don't think any words of mine could adequately describe the subtle magnificence of this beer. An extraordinary ordinary beer.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2015 From a tap at the brewpub. Clear golden, medium white head. Bready aroma with a touch of lager yeast notes, herbal hops. Medium bodied, low to medium carbonation. Dry with medium bitterness. Elegant.

At the source draft in Witzgall brauerei in Franconia-Germany. Pours a filtered and bright golden color, medium creamy white cap which stays long enough. Nose: white bread crumb, hidden farmhouse and hay notes, some grass although hops do not really characterize this beer. Mouth: yeasty notes, a bit going buttery with a distinctive easy drinking orientation. Low carbonation, soft body. It meets expectations but I will go for a Landbier tough. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at the brewery. Clear, brilliant gold, with a low, airy head. Malty nose, bread and biscuits, some esters, herbal hops. Somewhat sweet, malty flavor, light fruit, peaches or apricot, low hops. A bit herbal and peppery finish mooth, silky body. Low carbonation.

on tap at the brewery. clear, honeyed shade of golden with a billowing, foamy white head; gentle aroma of dandelions and freshly cracked grains; plenty of bitterness with a slightly syruppy malt character, freshly mown grass; no wonder the locals looked like theyd settled in for the day
Fast klares goldenes Bier mit einer ordentlichen weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, getreidig, leicht süß, etwas trocken. Geschmack dezent herb, getreidig, minimal fruchtig süß, süffig, gut!
Many thanks for this bottle to Beerhunter111. Gold beer with a fluffy white head. Palate is light and slightly soft. Mild carbonation. Light malt
(Bue chez Stöhrenkeller et à la brasserie): Paille, zest citronné sur une charpente croustillante et fragile. Longue en bouche, peu ou pas de sucres résiduels.

Bottle thanks to Cuso. Aroma is overall mild, rather stale blunt hoppiness. Light yeast. Clear yellow colour. Big white head, rather short duration. Taste has balance of hoppy bitterness, flavour is a bit stale. Some sweetness with very light malty flavour. Drinkable. Once again I remain puzzled by high reviews of others and mark this for rerate in future.
Bottle kindly donated by pivnizub, dekuji.  Sweet malty aroma. Malty taste with light bitter hops. OK.
Bottle, courtesy of Cuso. Pours pale yellow/golden color, white head. Aroma is malty, bit fruity, sweet. Taste is medium sweet, malty, hint of caramel.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2015 Vom Faß in der altmodischen Brauereigaststätte an einem ruhigen Vormittag im September 2013. Ein paar ältere Herren unterhalten sich mit gedämpfter Stimme oder lesen Zeitung. Es ist so ruhig wie in einem guten Café. Diese Franken sind wirklich ein angenehmer Menschenschlag ... - Das bestellte Bier schimmert goldgelb. Der Antrunk ist schlank, ausreichend gehopft, nicht süß. Leicht grasiger Hopfen. Schwach rezent. Mittlerer bitterer Nachtrunk. - Ein grundehrliches, enorm süffiges, harmonisches Bier ohne besonders hervorstechende Aromen. Wiederholung: Flasche (50 cl) von Hopfen & Malz, Berlin. - Helles Goldgelb, klar. - In der Nase brotige Malzsüße, etwas Banane, kaum Hopfen. - Antrunk mild süßlich hellmalzig, Weißbrot, matte Fruchtigkeit ohne Herbe. Hopfen ist nur ansatzweise zu erahnen: ein Hauch von stumpfem Gras. Durchschnittlich rezent. Im Abgang ganz schwache, ein wenig schale Herbe ohne Pep und Aroma. - Vom Faß vor Ort war dies Bier ein Gedicht; aus der Flasche ist es eine ganz andere Geschichte, nämlich ein fades, unterdurchschnittliches Helles ohne die wunderbare Süffigkeit und kernige Hopfung, die fränkische Biere auszeichnet. Dazu paßt die Verwendung von Hopfenextrakt, die das Etikett einräumt. Bestenfalls 2,4. Meine Bewertung hier ist ein Mittelwert.

On tap at the brewery. Clear gold thin white head. its fine. Malty yes. Hoppy yes. Wheat cereal flavour. Intense. Good. In all circumstances its a good beer. But I know that the Landbier is just down the road. Solid beer. Good cereal flavour good hops.
On tap at the brewery. Gold body with a nice foamy white head. Herbal aroma. Taste is malty, bready. Dry, slightly hoppy finish. A very good one
Golden with a lasting white head. Clean malty and herbal aroma, very inviting. Sweetish malty flavour with herbal hops and a refreshing, hoppy finish

Draft at the brewery.

Head is mostly diminishing.
Body is light to medium yellow.

Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain / cracker), moderately hoppy (flowers, herbs).

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, moderately bitter.

Light to medium body, watery/velvety texture, lively carbonation.

Very straightforward rendition, but very clean and precise and attractive.  What it may lack in charisma is made up in execution and sheer quaffability...this is made for drinking by the liter.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2013 Draught at Witzgall in Schlammersdorf, Nov 2012: Lustrous golden. Creamy and pasty white crown of foam. Pleasant nose of honeysuckle, lilac, pepper, lemon, minerals, fresh baguette Pils malt, new-mown hay, and a fleeting glimpse of fruitiness and lager yeast. Soft body. Stiff and tight carbonation. Firm hop bite trails a succulent kiss of malt and a well-defined flourish of toasted bread. Quite zippy with a strong mineral dimension accompanying the tightly structured malt base. Ample peppery zing exudes beneath the soothing Spalt-drenched nectars. Obscure lemon verbena herbalness adds intricacy to the refined hoppiness. Malt is sublimely clean and flawless within the lean frame. Squeaky clean, yet lip-smacking at the same time. Finishes crisply toasty with edgy baguette notions paired with appetizing dabs of vibrant flowery softness and a poignant yet teasing pepper aspect. A thoroughly enjoyable and dangerously quaffable helles (finished my 8 oz. pour within five minutes) that does everything flawlessly as it toes the line with extraordinary finesse and delicateness. I would feel blessed to have the fortune of drinking this liquid gold every single day. Good heavens is this clean!
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text:
UPDATED: MAY 7, 2015 Witzgall Vollbier Helles, draft at the brewery in Schlammersdorf, a noon start to the days bike ride involved this simple but lovely crisp and clean lager.  sharp, clear gold body with a hugely-rocky head, I dont know how not to give this a five, its a swimming pool of fluff.  yeah.  pretty straightforward pale malt sweetness (honey, crackers) and light edel hop nose (spice, dried grass, fruit cocktail) with a smacking, crisp finish (minerals, sweet corn, minor apple juice), mostly clean. quaffable and delicious, a very good helles, but quite basic.   continued down the road to Hallerndorf where we found some of the best lager around from Lieberth.
May 2013: Clean, minerallic, crisp, lightly sweet, medium to low bitterness.  subtle spalt lemon spice aroma hops.  toasty, clean, quiet malt flavor.  nut oils and cracker-y toasted malt.   

March 2015: Tangy, minerally, malty, bright, carbonic, lightly peppery, more hoppy than I remember: lemon-pepper-spice hoppiness. Super tangy and fresh, malty and perfectly clean, bright and juicy and oily, fragrant and lip smacking, hoppy as shit without much bitterness. Lovely fucking beer. Honeysuckle and flowers come to mind, and something like banana candy, which confuses me, but its not esters, seems malt-derived.

Bottle, at Plan B. A clear, golden beer wtih a small, dense, white head. Biscuity malts, butter crackers, citrusy fruityness and notes of apple on the nose. Grainy, malty flavor with fruityness and some bitterness. Too low on bitterness in the end too. Dry, medium bodied and smooth. A decent beer, but a bit too boring for my likings. 110527
Bottle at Plan B. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, hop. flavour is sweet, fruit, malt, hay, hop, grass. medium body. Ordinary beer.

Bottle @ Brewery. Poured into my ceramig Witzgall mug. Cloudy golden with an egg white head on top. Herbal and spicy hoppy nose. Lots of wet grain and bread. A bit of a rough hop bitterness. Smooth. Ends dry and hoppy.

Draught at the brew-pub.
Medium to short beige head.
Clear golden yellow color.
The aroma has some sawdust! and pilsner malts, followed by some quallity nobel hop aroma.
The taste is sweet, caramell sweet with a small bitterness and litle unbalanced.

Its golden with a creamy, white and lasting head, and the aroma has notes of bread, malt and flower. The flavour has a light sweetness and lovely notes of fresh-baked bread, straw and flower, and the finish is slightly dry  really nice.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours a clear yellow with a tall, dense white head leaving laces. Sweetish malty nose, but slightly skewed - biscuity. Medium body, low carbonation, sweet clean maltiness, again a little bonbonish though. Hardly any bitterness. 210511
50 cL bottle at Plan B. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is toasted malty and slight breadish. Sweet malty and slight toasted. Slight bitter and mild grassy finish.

Bottle at Plan B.
Clear golden coloured with a medium sized white head.
Malty aroma of hay, caramel and hops.
Malty flavour of hay, caramel and hops.
Hoppy finish.

Vollmundig hopfiger Antrunk mit angenehmen Herbetönen. Der Hopfen bringt dabei auch bittere Noten mit sich, hält sie aber weitgehend zurück.Spritzig, der Hopfen breitet sich im Abgang weiter aus. Gut!

(draught) pours a clear golden colour with a dense white head. faint aroma of pale malts, herbal hops and some light sweet spices. flavour is honeyed pale malts, with only the faintest hint of characteristic diacetyl and a herbal-hoppy finish. medium-bodied with smooth carbonation.

On tap at Brauerei Witzgall, Schlammersdorf, during Fin and Lozs cycle ride around villages to the South and South East of Bamberg, Germany 19-06-10   Gold colour with a white head. This didnt appear quite as bitter as the lager bier but it was very good all the same. This seemed to have a little more body than the lager, was a little sweeter and possibly easier drinking, with some straw and soft maltiness. But overall I think I preferred the lager.  A6 A4 F7 P4 Ov14  3.5

Bottled (from bierkompass.de). Schlammersdorfer Bräuhaus, Witzgall-bier Vollbier (4.7%), but probably this one. Yellowish golden colour, small white head. Aroma is bready malts, some grassy hops as well as some saltwatery and herbal notes. Flavour is bready malts, saltwater, some grassy hops. Quite bodied actually, but the flavour is a bit boring.
Clear golden with a large white head. Sweet and malty aroma.flavour was malty and had vague grassy hops.

Golden colour.  The head is alive, like blasting missiles into the surface of the moon.  Herbal, slightly fruity hop nose.  Theres a hint of buttery but with good herbal notes and clean, fresh bready malts.

Draft @ brewpub. Bright gold. White thick alive head. Aroma is really fresh grain. Great quaffability with minerals on the tongue. Great vollbier balance, sweeter than kellerbier, has a nice hop but a stunningly strong grain background. Nutty, dry, delicious.

Draught at the brewpub.  Clear deep golden, creamy head. Pleasant aroma of grassy hops and floral perfumy malt. Medium bodied with soft mouthfeel. Pleasant bitterish finish. Typical Franconian lager with it soft edgelessness and superb drinkability.

Draught @ Brauerei Witzgall, Hallerndorf-Schlammersdorf, Oberfranken/Bayern, Germany. Clear medium yellow orange color with a large, frothy - creamy, excellent lacing, fully lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, fruity, light yeasty, toffee. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium to light, texture is oily - watery, carbonation is soft. (220308)

(draught at the brewpub) Clear, golden colour with a big and dense foamy white head. Light-sweet, straw malty nose with herbal hops and a touch of barnyard. Bitter and slightly sweet flavour; malty, slightly strawy taste with herbal hops from the beginning; light to medium bodied with a crispy carbonation and a fresh mouthfeel; dry and moderately bitter finish with noticeable hops character. Refreshing and pleasant Helles with rural character.

Bottle.  Clear golden with a medium lacy/fluffy white head.  Malty aroma, lightly sweet, hint of veggie/corn (but not of the adjunct variety).  Simple, straightforward malty taste, lightly herby wth an even lighter spicey/floral sweetness.  Touch of grain.  Hop profile makes me think of slightly easterly lands.  Absurdly well-balanced with a delicious pale malty aftertaste.  Smooth feel.  This would be a fantastic session for everyday drinking.  Thanks to pivnizub!

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2014 Impressions from the hof:
-Golden clarity benefits but from a veil of head.
-Fresh cereal and toast politely entice.
-Effervescent carbonation is still softer than the usual gassed up lager, but evokes a frail body in this particular case.
-Simple-minded maltiness is still effective.
-Finishes softly, with whispering hop bitterness.
-This doesnt evoke Franconian lagers at all, strangely enough.

On tap at the brewery a few times and at Bambergs Stohrenkeller.

Bottle, bought at the brewery. Golden color, lasting creamy head. Malty, vaguely vegetable aroma. Malty flavor. For a helles a firm flowery hoppiness. Just a touch of sweetness. A hint of sulphur. Bitter aftertaste with boiled milk. Maybe this beer just doesnt travel well.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2008 From the tap (at the brewery): Golden coloured, medium-sized fluffy head, herbal hoppy aroma; initial sweetish fruitiness, malty flavour, replaced by a bitterness, which gives a dry hoppy finish; very well balanced, well rounded: the malty body and the fine hoppiness go together very well..........
Superb!
